verses.verse: When<WH3588> you sit<WH3427> to eat<WH3898> with a ruler,<WH4910> consider<WH995> diligently what<WH853> <WH834> is before<WH6440> you:
And put<WH7760> a knife<WH7915> to your throat,<WH3930> if<WH518> you be a man<WH1167> given<WH1167> to appetite.<WH5315>
Be not desirous<WH183> of his dainties:<WH4303> for they are deceitful<WH3577> meat.<WH3899>
Labor<WH3021> not to be rich:<WH6238> cease<WH2308> from your own wisdom.<WH998>
Will you set<WH5774> your eyes<WH5869> on that which is not? for riches certainly make<WH6213> themselves wings;<WH3671> they fly<WH5774> away as an eagle<WH5404> toward heaven.<WH8064>
Eat<WH3898> you not the bread<WH3899> of him that has an evil<WH7451> eye,<WH5869> neither<WH408> desire<WH183> you his dainty<WH4303> meats:
For as he thinks<WH8176> in his heart,<WH5315> so<WH3651> is he: Eat<WH398> and drink,<WH8354> said<WH559> he to you; but his heart<WH3820> is not with you.
The morsel<WH6595> which you have eaten<WH398> shall you vomit<WH6958> up, and lose<WH7843> your sweet<WH5273> words.<WH1697>
Speak<WH1696> not in the ears<WH241> of a fool:<WH3684> for he will despise<WH936> the wisdom<WH7922> of your words.<WH4405>
Remove<WH5253> not the old<WH5769> landmark;<WH1366> and enter<WH935> not into the fields<WH7704> of the fatherless:<WH3490>
For their redeemer<WH1350> is mighty;<WH2389> he shall plead<WH7378> their cause<WH7379> with you.
Apply<WH935> your heart<WH3820> to instruction,<WH4148> and your ears<WH241> to the words<WH561> of knowledge.<WH1847>
Withhold<WH4513> not correction<WH4148> from the child:<WH5288> for if you beat<WH5221> him with the rod,<WH7626> he shall not die.<WH4191>
You shall beat<WH5221> him with the rod,<WH7626> and shall deliver<WH5337> his soul<WH5315> from hell.<WH7585>
My son,<WH1121> if<WH518> your heart<WH3820> be wise,<WH2449> my heart<WH3820> shall rejoice,<WH8055> even<WH1571> mine.<WH589>
Yes, my reins<WH3629> shall rejoice,<WH5937> when your lips<WH8193> speak<WH1696> right<WH4339> things.
Let not your heart<WH3820> envy<WH7065> sinners:<WH2400> but be you in the fear<WH3374> of the LORD<WH3068> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long.
For surely there is an end;<WH319> and your expectation<WH8615> shall not be cut<WH3772> off.
Hear<WH8085> you, my son,<WH1121> and be wise,<WH2449> and guide<WH833> your heart<WH3820> in the way.<WH1870>
Be not among winebibbers;<WH5433> <WH3196> among riotous<WH2151> eaters<WH2151> of flesh:<WH1320>
For the drunkard<WH5435> and the glutton<WH2151> shall come to poverty:<WH3423> and drowsiness<WH5124> shall clothe<WH3847> a man with rags.<WH7168>
Listen<WH8085> to your father<WH1> that begat<WH3205> you, and despise<WH936> not your mother<WH517> when<WH3588> she is old.<WH2204>
Buy<WH7069> the truth,<WH571> and sell<WH4376> it not; also wisdom,<WH2451> and instruction,<WH4148> and understanding.<WH998>
The father<WH1> of the righteous<WH6662> shall greatly rejoice:<WH1523> and he that begets<WH3205> a wise<WH2450> child shall have joy<WH8056> of him.
Your father<WH1> and your mother<WH517> shall be glad,<WH8056> and she that bore<WH3205> you shall rejoice.<WH1523>
My son,<WH1121> give<WH5414> me your heart,<WH3820> and let your eyes<WH5869> observe<WH5341> my ways.<WH1870>
For a whore<WH2181> is a deep<WH6013> ditch;<WH7745> and a strange<WH5237> woman is a narrow<WH6862> pit.<WH875>
She also<WH637> lies in wait<WH693> as for a prey,<WH2863> and increases<WH3254> the transgressors<WH898> among men.<WH120>

Who<WH4310> has woe?<WH188> who<WH4310> has sorrow?<WH17> who<WH4310> has contentions?<WH4079> who<WH4310> has babbling?<WH7879> who<WH4310> has wounds<WH6482> without<WH2600> cause?<WH2600> who<WH4310> has redness<WH2448> of eyes?<WH5869>
They that tarry<WH309> long at<WH5921> the wine;<WH3196> they that go<WH935> to seek<WH2713> mixed<WH4469> wine.<WH4469>
Look<WH7200> not you on the wine<WH3196> when<WH3588> it is red,<WH119> when<WH3588> it gives<WH5414> his color<WH5869> in the cup,<WH3599> when it moves<WH1980> itself aright.<WH4339>
At the last<WH319> it bites<WH5391> like a serpent,<WH5175> and stings<WH6567> like an adder.<WH6848>
Your eyes<WH5869> shall behold<WH7200> strange<WH2114> women, and your heart<WH3820> shall utter<WH1696> perverse<WH8419> things.
Yes, you shall be as he that lies<WH7901> down<WH7901> in the middle<WH3820> of the sea,<WH3220> or as he that lies<WH7901> on the top<WH7218> of a mast.<WH2260>

They have stricken<WH5221> me, shall you say, and I was not sick;<WH2470> they have beaten<WH1986> me, and I felt<WH3045> it not: when<WH4970> shall I awake?<WH6974> I will seek<WH1245> it yet again.<WH5750>
